item.title: Apple M4 iMac at an All-Time Low Is Now Cheap Enough to Rival No-Name Windows Desktops
item.content:encoded:
As we come barreling toward the end of the year, you can still find all sorts of great tech deals. Lots of good stuff has been marked down for holiday shopping, but there is no rule against using these hefty discounts to secure a nice new gift for yourself. If you’re been in the marker for a new computer, you can upgrade to the Apple iMac right now while saving yourself 12%. That may not sound like a ton, but it actually cuts the price down by $150. The M4-powered iMac which usually runs for $1,299 is now just $1,149 through the holiday season.

This 2024 Apple iMac all-in-one desktop computer is powered by the M4 chip. This chip is one of Apple’s most powerful yet. The M5 just came out, but this one is still remarkably reliable. It’s built for Apple Intelligence and will keep your system running smoothly whether you are editing photos, building out decks, gaming, or bouncing between a million and one browser tabs.

See at Amazon

Immersive Display

With an all-in-on computer, you’re committed to whatever screen its built out of. Good thing this one is sleek as heck. The 24-inch retina monitor displays in a crisp resolution of 4.5K and features 500 nits of brightness. The screen supports up to one billion colors, so you will be looking at a highly detailed screen with a ton of color depth. This is excellent for anyone who works in a visual medium all the time like photographers touching up their photos.

With this iMac, you have a built-in camera and microphones for all your video conferencing needs. The 12MP webcam is equipped with Center Stage. This is a features that tracks the person in view, subtle adjusting the camera to follow them for both a more dynamic video feed and to ensure they always stay in frame. It even works for groups in front of the camera. The three on-board microphones can capture studio-quality audio and the six speakers utilize Spatial Audio for an enhanced listening experience, both on calls and when watching various media—be it a movie, show, or random YouTube video.

If you’re already in the Apple ecosystem with an iPhone or iPad, you can seamlessly integrate your devices with the iMac. Copy something from your iPhone and paste it to your iMac. Sends texts using your keyboard at your iMac. Lots of versatility.

The iMac is strikingly thin. It’s just a good looking piece of hardware. Plus, it comes is a variety of fun colors. You can stick with the traditional silver is you want something that will fit any aesthetic. Or you can opt for something with a bit more pizzaz. Amazon has the blue, green, and pink options in stock along with the silver. The blue, green, and silver are each seeing that $150 discount. The pink model is still on sale, but you’ll only save a bit over $100 as its price tag has only dropped to $1,196.

See at Amazon

item.title: This 2-Pack Govee Smart Light Bulbs Offers 16 Million Colors, Priced Like Basic Bulb on Amazon
item.content:encoded:
If there’s one thing that can transform how your home feels without dropping hundreds on new furniture, it’s the lighting you choose. These Govee smart bulbs now cost just $17 for a two-pack on Amazon, down from the usual $25, and you can stack an extra 10% off with the promo code IZVCRPT14KV7 to hit a record low price that makes upgrading your entire house ridiculously affordable.

You get 1000 lumens of brightness per bulb (equivalent to old 75W incandescents), access to 16 million colors, tunable white light from warm 2700K to cool 6500K, Wi-Fi and Bluetooth connectivity, and full voice control through Alexa or Google Assistant. These bulbs create different atmospheres for different moods without you touching a dimmer switch. Order today and Amazon delivers them before Christmas.

See at Amazon

1000 Lumens Really Lights Up Big Rooms

That 1000-lumen output is a lot more important than it sounds like it would be: Cheap smart bulbs usually only go up to 600–800 lumens which means that even at full brightness, they don’t light up big rooms very well. You can make them brighter when you need task lighting or dim them down across the full 1–100% range for ambiance. The CRI90+ color rendering index makes colors look real and true instead of washed out like they do under cheap LEDs.

You can choose from 16 million colors so you can get the exact shade you want instead of going through a few presets that never quite match what you had in mind. You can make your living room glow purple while your kitchen stays warm white, or you can set all the bulbs to the same energizing blue-white for morning routines. The tunable white range goes from 2700K to 6500K which is the range of colors that goes from the warmth of candlelight to the brightness of office daylight.

The Govee Home app gives you access to 54 scene modes that handle the color programming for you if you don’t want to manually adjust settings. Music sync mode makes the bulbs change colors when your phone’s microphone picks up sound, turning any playlist into a light show that pulses with the beat. Sunrise and sunset timers gradually brighten or dim the lights to wake you naturally or ease you into evening, and you can schedule these automations to match your actual daily routine instead of fumbling for switches half-asleep.

You can control these bulbs from anywhere using the app, even when you’re not home, which lets you turn the lights on before you get there or check to see if you left something on after you left. You can change the brightness, colors, or turn lights on and off with your voice using Alexa or Google Assistant. This feels like the future at first, but then it quickly becomes the only way you want to interact with lights. The dual connectivity also acts as a backup; if your Wi-Fi goes down, you can still use Bluetooth to control things locally.

The bulbs fit in standard A19 sockets and work with any lamp or fixture that takes regular screw-in bulbs and makes installation as easy as changing old bulbs. Most routers send out 2.4GHz Wi-Fi signals, which these devices can connect to. These 9-watt bulbs use a lot less electricity than old 75-watt incandescent bulbs, but they still give off the same amount of light.

The $17 price for two bulbs becomes even better when you apply that 10% promo code, and brings your effective cost down to around $7.65 per bulb. That’s cheaper than many dumb LED bulbs that just turn on and off, except these give you millions of colors, remote control, voice commands, scheduling, and music sync capabilities.

item.title: MacBook Pro M5 With Max Config Drops Record Low, Amazon Drops Margin While Official Site Stays Full Price
item.content:encoded:
Apple just came out with these M5 MacBook Pro models a few weeks ago and they’re still full price on Apple’s website, but Amazon decided to spread some holiday cheer by lowering the prices on all models to all-time lows.

The 24GB/1TB model now costs $1,799 instead of $1,999, and the 16GB/512GB model now costs $1,349 instead of $1,599. This means that these M5 machines are actually cheaper than the M4 generation was when it first came out. You get here Apple’s new M5 chip, a stunning 14.2-inch Liquid display that can reach 1600 nits of brightness and a battery lasts all day. The 24GB model will be shipped before Christmas, and the 16GB model will be sent by the end of the year.

See at Amazon

Powerful M5 Chip

The M5 processor doesn’t just make the M4 better but it also changes the way a laptop handles heavy workloads. Each GPU core now has a Neural Accelerator that speeds up AI tasks by a lot which means you can handle machine learning workloads and Apple Intelligence features at speeds that would have needed a desktop workstation just a few years ago. The 10-core CPU can easily handle everything from video editing to compiling software and the unified memory architecture means that your RAM talks directly to the processor, so there are no bottlenecks like those that happen with regular laptop designs.

Apple Intelligence runs completely on your device so your private information never leaves your MacBook to be processed on a cloud server. The system helps you write better, make your ideas clearer, and do repetitive tasks automatically without sending your data to Apple or anyone else. This privacy-first approach is much more important than most people think and it lets you use AI features without worrying that your emails, documents, or creative work will end up in a training dataset.

The 14.2-inch Liquid Retina XDR display has a peak brightness of 1600 nits for HDR content and a steady brightness of 1000 nits for regular use. The 1,000,000:1 contrast ratio makes blacks look really black instead of that grayish tone you see on cheaper laptop screens. The colors are also very accurate, making this a good choice for professional photo and video work.

The promise of a battery life that lasts all day isn’t just a marketing gimmick: This laptop works the same whether it’s plugged in or running on battery power. Most Windows laptops slow down when you unplug them to save power, but the M5’s efficiency lets you render video, compile code, or run resource-intensive creative apps at full speed for hours without needing to find an outlet. You can really take this to a coffee shop and work all day without bringing the charger.

The ability to work with other Apple devices makes the whole ecosystem better than any one product could do on its own: You can control your iPhone from your Mac’s screen with iPhone Mirroring which means you can reply to texts or use apps that only work on iPhones without having to pick up your phone. You can copy something on your iPhone and paste it straight into a document on your Mac. You can also start a FaceTime call on your laptop and then switch to your phone when you need to move around.

The 24GB/1TB model costs $1,799, and the 16GB/512GB model costs $1,349 and that’s less than what the M4 generation cost when it first came out.

See at Amazon

item.title: NordProtect Online Identity Service Covers Up to $10K in Scam Losses, Now Going for Peanuts
item.content:encoded:
The last shopping rush before Christmas is a great time for cybercriminals because there are so many online transactions, quick purchases, and distracted shoppers. NordProtect’s decision to lower the price of its identity protection service to a record low of $4.49 per month, down from its usual $14.99 rate, is especially important this time of year, when prices are usually lower.

This isn’t just another holiday sale on electronics or entertainment subscriptions that people don’t care about: Identity theft protection deals with a basic security issue that gets worse around the holidays, when fake transactions blend in more easily with real spending patterns and stolen credentials are more actively traded on criminal networks.

See NordProtect

The Scale of the Problem

Think about how bad identity theft is in the United States right now. According to the Federal Trade Commission, consumers lost $12.5 billion to fraud last year alone. This is a 25% increase from the year before. In 2024, the agency handled more than 1.1 million identity theft complaints. This means that a new victim came forward every 22 seconds throughout the year.

Identity Theft by the Numbers

  • Every 22 seconds: A new identity theft case occurs in the United States
  • 1.1 million: Identity theft complaints filed with the FTC in 2024
  • $12.5 billion: Total consumer losses to fraud in the past year
  • 44%: Percentage of identity theft cases involving credit card fraud

These risks are even higher during the holidays: More people shopping online means more chances for data theft, and when there are a lot of legitimate transactions, it’s harder to spot fake charges right away. Phishing attempts that look like shipping notifications or seasonal sales alerts are on the rise, and retailers and payment processors are at greater risk of breaches because their infrastructure is under stress and they have to hire temporary workers.

How Protection Really Works

Instead of checking identities by hand every so often, NordProtect uses continuous automated surveillance. You can read Gizmodo’s review here to learn more about it. NordProtect checks credit reports from all three major bureaus, looks for personal information on dark web marketplaces, and keeps an eye on linked financial accounts for strange activity.

The part that watches the dark web is especially important: There are parts of the internet (dark web) where stolen Social Security numbers, credit card numbers, and full identity packages are traded. When your information shows up in these places, it usually means that there has been a security breach in one of the services you use. Early detection is important because it gives you time to lock down accounts before criminals can use the information.

TransUnion’s credit monitoring service can catch things like new loan applications, account openings, or changes to your credit limit that you didn’t authorize. The system marks these events right away instead of waiting for monthly reviews of credit reports. When you monitor your bank account, you can spot strange withdrawal patterns, suspicious transfer requests, or debit card use that isn’t safe.

See NordProtect

The value proposition goes beyond just alerts: NordProtect gives you specific instructions on what to do when it finds a problem. If your email is part of a data breach, you will be told which accounts need new passwords, which security questions need to be changed, and whether or not two-factor authentication should be turned on. The service explains how to dispute charges that are not real and how to freeze your credit if they do.

Financial Protection That Goes Beyond Monitoring

Most people don’t realize how much it costs to recover from identity theft until they have to deal with it directly. For example, hiring a lawyer to fight fraudulent accounts can cost hundreds of dollars per hour. If you have to take time off work to deal with banks, creditors, and credit bureaus, you will lose money. And the costs of traveling to meet with law enforcement or financial institutions in person add up.

NordProtect covers up to $1 million in identity theft recovery costs, including legal fees, lost wages, and documented costs related to restoring your identity and credit score.

See NordProtect

Extra parts of insurance cover certain types of threats that aren’t usually covered by identity theft: Cyber extortion coverage pays up to $50,000 for cases of blackmail or ransom demands. Online fraud protection will pay up to $10,000 for money that is stolen directly from bank accounts or credit cards through digital scams. These amounts of coverage show how much damage advanced attacks can do.

Access to dedicated case management may be more valuable than money: When someone steals your identity, NordProtect sends a U.S.-based expert to handle the whole recovery process. This case manager talks to credit bureaus, files reports with banks and the police, keeps track of dispute deadlines, and keeps an eye on the case until it is resolved.

The Cost of Preventing

NordProtect is currently charging $4.49 a month, which is 71% less than the normal price and it is the lowest price the service has ever been offered at. This makes full identity protection cheaper than most streaming subscriptions or a single trip to a coffee shop. The service comes with a 30-day money-back guarantee so you don’t have to worry about losing money if it doesn’t meet your security needs.

Look at this cost next to the possible costs of recovery. The Identity Theft Resource Center says that people who have their identities stolen spend an average of 200 hours trying to fix the problem. Even at a low hourly wage, this means thousands of dollars in lost productivity. When you add up the costs of hiring a lawyer, buying credit monitoring services after the fact, and possible losses from fake transactions, prevention is much cheaper than reaction.

See NordProtect
